item.title: 印度外长将自2015年以来首次访问巴基斯坦
item.description: 印度政府周五晚些时候表示，印度外交部长苏布拉哈曼亚姆-贾尚卡尔（Subrahmanyam Jaishankar）将代替总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）出席在巴基斯坦举行的由中国牵头的峰会。【原文：India’s External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar will attend a China-led summit in Pakistan in place of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the government said late Friday.】

item.title: 世界顶级铀矿商投票决定重返核电市场
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦的选民将于周日决定是否允许建造一座核电站，因为他们担心核电站对环境的影响以及在技术上可能会依赖中亚国家的两大邻国--中国和俄罗斯。【原文：Voters in Kazakhstan will decide on Sunday whether to allow construction of a nuclear power plant amid worries over the environmental impact as well as the potential reliance on the Central Asian nation’s two giant neighbors — China and Russia — for technology.】

item.title: Vista Outdoor 将以 34 亿美元出售 Revelyst 和 Kinetic 部门
item.description: Vista Outdoor 公司在一份声明中表示，已同意以总价 33.5 亿美元的价格出售两家公司。【原文：Vista Outdoor Inc. has agreed to sell two units for a total of $3.35 billion, the company said in a statement.】

item.title: 永利度假村获得阿联酋博彩运营商许可证
item.description: 永利度假村有限公司（Wynn Resorts Ltd.）表示，阿联酋商业博彩监管总局（General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority）已向该公司颁发了阿联酋首张商业博彩运营商执照。【原文：Wynn Resorts Ltd. said it has been awarded the first commercial gaming operator’s license in the United Arab Emirates by the country’s General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority.】

item.title: 印度各邦即将举行投票，莫迪直面农民的愤怒
item.description: 印度北部哈里亚纳邦周六举行地方选举，考验总理纳伦德拉-莫迪在因政府农作物价格政策而愤怒的农民中的支持率。【原文：India’s northern state of Haryana holds local elections Saturday, testing Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s support among farmers angered by the government’s policies over crop prices.】

item.title: 本-霍洛维茨支持特朗普后将向哈里斯竞选活动捐款
item.description: 风险投资家本-霍洛维茨（Ben Horowitz）和他的妻子计划向美国副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）的总统竞选活动提供一笔 "巨额 "捐款，而这距离他们支持哈里斯的竞争对手、前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）仅过去了三个月。【原文：Venture capitalist Ben Horowitz and his wife plan to make a “significant” donation to the presidential campaign of US Vice President Kamala Harris, just three months after supporting Harris’ rival, former President Donald Trump.】

item.title: Ed Yardeni 认为就业报告发布后美联储将在 2024 年暂停降息
item.description: 华尔街资深人士埃德-亚德尼（Ed Yardeni）认为，美联储 2024 年的货币宽松政策可能已经结束，因为周五强劲的劳动力报告凸显了全球最大经济体的顽强韧性。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s monetary-easing campaign for 2024 may already be over as the strong labor report Friday underscores the stubborn resilience of the world’s largest economy, according to Wall Street veteran Ed Yardeni.】

item.title: Klarna 董事会在冲突中寻求联合创始人的盟友下台
item.description: Klarna Bank AB 董事会同意罢免该公司联合创始人维克多-雅各布松（Victor Jacobsson）的一位盟友，因为这家 "现购现付 "的瑞典公司内部冲突不断。【原文：Klarna Bank AB’s board has agreed to remove an ally of the firm’s co-founder Victor Jacobsson amid a continued clash at the Swedish buy-now, pay-later firm which is preparing for a potential public offering next year.】

item.title: 即将离职的美国证券交易委员会执法主管格鲁瓦尔将加入米尔班克律师事务所
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国证券交易委员会最高执法官员 Gurbir Grewal 本月晚些时候离开监管机构后，将加入律师事务所 Milbank。【原文：Gurbir Grewal, the US Securities and Exchange Commission’s top enforcement official, will join law firm Milbank after he leaves the regulator later this month, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 野村称鲍威尔影响力过大预示美联储缩表幅度将减小
item.description: 野村证券国际公司（Nomura Securities International）的 Aichi Amemiya 认为，美联储很可能在 11 月和 12 月的政策会议上将降息幅度缩小至 25 个基点。【原文：The Federal Reserve is likely to downsize its rate cuts to 25 basis points at both the November and December policy meetings, according to Aichi Amemiya at Nomura Securities International.】

item.title: TPG 聘用摩根大通资深人士宋志平领导股权资本市场业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，TPG 公司已聘请摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：TPG Inc. has hired JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s co-head of technology equity capital markets Eugene Sohn, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 就业日震撼平反 2024 年风险大反弹
item.description: 美国经济始终保持强劲势头，再次给华尔街的忧虑者们带来了灾难，他们全年都在敲响经济衰退的警钟。【原文：The ever-resilient US economy is once again causing havoc for Wall Street worrywarts, who have sounded the recession alarm all year.】

item.title: 路透社称力拓正在洽谈收购钒锂公司
item.description: 路透社援引未具名消息人士的话报道称，力拓集团（Rio Tinto Plc）正在洽谈收购钒锂公司（Arcadium Lithium Plc），这笔交易对这家小型矿商的估值将在 40 亿至 60 亿美元之间。【原文：Rio Tinto Plc is said to be in talks to buy Arcadium Lithium Plc, in a deal that would value the smaller miner between $4 billion to $6 billion, Reuters reported, citing unnamed sources.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚首次获得投资评级，S&P 公司提升债券评级
item.description: 塞尔维亚的主权信用评级被 S&P Global Ratings（S&P 全球评级公司）提升，使其外币债券脱离了垃圾级，开始向投资级发行人转型。【原文：Serbia’s sovereign credit score was upgraded by S&P Global Ratings, lifting its foreign-currency bonds out of junk status and starting the country’s transformation to an investment grade issuer.】

item.title: 摩根大通客户在痴呆症中失去 5000 万美元财富，却被拒绝审判
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：A once-wealthy JPMorgan Chase & Co. client whose portfolio crumbled as he slid into dementia lost a legal battle seeking to recoup his fortune from the bank.】

item.title: 加纳人呼吁政府关闭所有非法金矿
item.description: 在第二天的抗议活动中，数百名加纳人呼吁政府取缔非洲头号黄金生产国的非法采矿活动。【原文：Hundreds of Ghanaians have called on their government to clamp down on illegal mining in Africa’s top gold producer in a second day of protests.】

item.title: 布朗大学捐赠基金在以色列撤资投票前增长 11
item.description: 截至今年 6 月，布朗大学捐赠基金的回报率为 11.3%，基金价值增至 72 亿美元。【原文：Brown University’s endowment returned 11.3% for the year ended in June, boosting the fund’s value to $7.2 billion.】

item.title: 芝加哥所有校董将在预算混乱中辞职
item.description: 芝加哥市教育委员会的七名成员将于本月晚些时候全部卸任，这将结束几个月来芝加哥市与学区之间不断升级的紧张关系，因为双方都面临着巨额赤字。【原文：All seven Chicago Board of Education members will step down later this month, capping months of escalating tensions between the city and its school district as both face big deficits.】

item.title: 加拿大养老金聘请施罗德的 Sophie van Oosterom 领导房地产业务
item.description: 加拿大养老金计划投资委员会（Canada Pension Plan Investment Board）聘请索菲-范-奥斯特罗姆（Sophie van Oosterom）担任房地产部主管，熟悉内情的人士称，这位施罗德集团（Schroders Plc）的高管将负责管理一个近来回报微薄的投资组合。【原文：Canada Pension Plan Investment Board hired Sophie van Oosterom as head of real estate, people familiar with the matter said, tapping the Schroders Plc executive to run a portfolio that has earned meager returns of late.】

item.title: 摩根大通称庞大的就业人数关闭了新兴市场地方债务的窗口
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. moved to the sidelines on emerging-market local bonds, shifting out of its positive stance after less than a month as traders reassess the path for the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cutting cycle.】

item.title: 意大利电信董事会授权首席执行官讨论 Sparkle 收购事宜
item.description: 意大利电信公司（Telecom Italia SpA）首席执行官皮埃特罗-拉布里奥拉（Pietro Labriola）已获得公司董事会授权，就其海底光缆部门 7 亿欧元（7.67 亿美元）的非约束性竞购进行谈判。【原文：Telecom Italia SpA Chief Executive Officer Pietro Labriola has been authorized by the company’s board of directors to negotiate a €700 million ($767 million) non-binding bid for its submarine cable unit.】

item.title: 橡树树支持的 STG 达成债务协议，颠覆债权人地位
item.description: 据知情人士透露，橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management）支持的 STG 物流公司与一组贷款人达成了一项协议，对其债务堆栈进行了全面调整，允许他们在还款优先权方面领先于同行。【原文：Oaktree Capital Management-backed STG Logistics reached a deal with a group of lenders that overhauls its debt stack and allows them to jump ahead of peers in the repayment priority line, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Tempur Sealy 为收购床垫公司出售 16 亿美元贷款
item.description: 以富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.）为首的一批银行周五出售了一笔 16 亿美元的杠杆贷款，以资助 Tempur Sealy International Inc.【原文：A group of banks led by Wells Fargo & Co. sold a $1.6 billion leveraged loan Friday to help fund Tempur Sealy International Inc.’s proposed acquisition of Mattress Firm Group Inc. that the Federal Trade Commission is seeking to block.】

item.title: 卡彭特声称他在特斯拉上赚了 3.06 亿美元，然后血本无归
item.description: 来自加拿大温哥华岛的木匠克里斯托弗-德沃奇特（Christopher DeVocht）说，他一开始和很多日内交易者一样。下班后，他在论坛上阅读有关交易的信息。他最喜欢交易的是特斯拉公司股票的期权。【原文：Christopher DeVocht, a carpenter from Vancouver Island, Canada, says he started out like a lot of day traders. After work, he’d read about trading on forums. His favorite things to trade were options on Tesla Inc. stock.】

item.title: 强劲就业报告减轻美联储下次会议压力
item.description: 9 月份出人意料的强劲招聘减少了人们对美国劳动力市场的担忧，从而减轻了美联储的压力，使政策制定者有余地在未来几个月以更渐进的步伐继续降息。【原文：Surprisingly strong hiring in September has taken pressure off the Federal Reserve by reducing worries over the US labor market, giving policymakers room to continue cutting interest rates at a more gradual pace in coming months.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：货币市场会把你搞得一团糟
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 科斯拉表示，尽管有人离职，但 OpenAI 的团队依然强大
item.description: 人工智能初创公司OpenAI的早期投资人维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）表示，尽管最近有不少人离职，但OpenAI仍拥有一支非常强大的技术团队。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup OpenAI has a strong, very technical team in place despite the number of recent departures, said Vinod Khosla, an early investor in the company.】

item.title: DSV 募资据称将吸引 300 亿美元投资者订单
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，DSV A/S 周四的股票销售吸引了超过 300 亿美元的订单，因为对这笔交易的需求超过了发售股票数量的五倍多。【原文：DSV A/S’s share sale on Thursday drew in excess of $30 billion in orders as demand for the deal surpassed the number of shares on offer by more than five times, according to people familiar with the matter.】
